messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Needing a name for a mailing list
messages.msgSnippet: Ooooh... creepy. Half my post was lost.  It had become a link (not a WORKing link, a lame-o link) for that magick school and just fell of the earth in bright
messages.messageBody:
Ooooh... creepy.
Half my post was lost. It had become a link (not a WORKing link, a lame-o
link) for that magick school and just fell of the earth in bright blue
underlined useless letters.
Here's what should've been there:




-=-Topics can range from church, homeschool ideas, housekeeping tips, words
of encouragement etc-=-

NOT much range.

-=- just talk including, scripture, God, church, parents, kids, home
cleaning, lessons and curriculum, on-line courses, and web sites. -=-

They listed unschooling as a keyword. Very sad.

And the pagan school... "schudual changes. . . . all who are sincre about .
. ."

I guess not teaching my kids to write is okay.

***sigh***

So I need something short yet descriptive, clever, yet easy to spell.
Something non offensive, something maybe catchy, to draw people together, but
to ward off people we don't want to attract and let people know right away we
don't want them to come and advertise the algebra home course they just wrote
last week and that we don't want to hire someone for $350 to come and tell
our group about Charlotte Masons or Charlotte Shriners nor even Charlotte
Rainbow Girls.

The iconography of New Mexico involves road runners, zias, desert this,
mountain that, RioGrandeWhatever...
Maybe TopSecretUnschoolers
or
NancyUnDrewSchoolers
or
Pinky and the Unschooled Brain (way too long)

Unschoolulu
BabaUnschoolLoo

HomeKids
Play Play Play

Yatta Hey! (kind of a combo Japanese and Navajo...)

Very Serious Playgroup
SeriousPlay

PlayDay

.....
Holly says it should be something the kids can say so they can talk about
going there. So the name of the yahoogroup needs to be what the

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Needing a name for a mailing list
messages.msgSnippet: ... No one would ever forget it. Nancy
messages.messageBody:
on 4/25/03 7:50 PM, SandraDodd@... at SandraDodd@... wrote:

> Holly says it should be something the kids can say so they can talk about
> going there. So the name of the yahoogroup needs to be what the kids will
> call what they go to.
>
> Scratch'n'Sniff, Holly just recommended. Then she farted dramatically.


No one would ever forget it.

Nancy

messages.subject: Needing a name for a mailing list
messages.msgSnippet: I tried to name a New Mexico Unschooling list Goof Group.  That was the name of our old unschooling group.  But it s taken, by fans of A Goofy Movie. Fine.
messages.messageBody:
I tried to name a New Mexico Unschooling list "Goof Group." That was the
name of our old unschooling group. But it's taken, by fans of A Goofy Movie.


Fine.

So I started looking to see what's already taken. The other working list (I
had shared with two other locals for feedback) was this:

Wait...
What should I call this list? There are a couple of southern Colorado
(Durango corner) people...
It should be easy to spell, easy to remember, not ambiguous.
NMun?
too short?
enchantingunschooling?
too long?
ZiaUnschool?
learningwithoutcrap?
(no, I guess not)
Any ideas?
Doddlocal?
(but Holly will grow up and I'll be out of it)

Our old group was called "the Goof Group"
goofgroup@yahoogroups?

Can't have goofgroup.

So I came here to sit on my unschooling cyber-couch and put my feet
figuratively up and to think aloud.

I found the following detritus while looking: I have a three year old group
called "NewMexicoHomeschooling with 125 people or so on it and found this
one, newer, and some other oddities



NewMexicoHomeschool

This is a mailing list for people who home schooling or are thinking of
homeschooling in New Mexico. Kids and Parents alike! Here you can exchange
ideas! support each other! give links for school stuff! just talk including,
scripture, God, church, parents, kids, home cleaning, lessons and curriculum,
on-line courses, and web sites. Please be considerate of others Please, no
rude talk, bad language, or anything of the sort. This is an unmoderated list
and the list owner does not have any legal responsibility to any postings.
Please-no SPAMMERS! No bad words and no teasing and no racism! Keywords-
student contenthomeschool,Homeschool,homeschooling,Homeschooling,home
school,home, home schooling, homeschooling, homeschool education, educated,
educator, unschooling, curriculum reviews, support group forums,

4 HSinNM
This is a list for Christian homeschooling parents in New Mexico and the
whole Southwest. Parents to be, those thinking about homeschooling and those
from other states are welcome also. Topics can range from church, homeschool
ideas, housekeeping tips, words of encouragement etc. Lets just remember to
conduct ourselves in a Christian way at all times and not everyone one thinks
just like you. Thanks! (We are working on our links -- check them out and add
some too)

WantedPaganTeachers
Welcome to the Star Acaademy of Magick... We are... a private pagan boarding
school located in southern New Mexico. We are accepting resumes for teacher
positions to teach the required subjects by the State of New Mexico in
General Education. (FULL YAHOO PROFILE REQUIRED FOR THIS LIST). Our Pagan
World Webring... [ Join Now | Ring List | Random | | <a href="http
//scripts.cgispy.com/webring/
www.TheGifted.org
20 StarAcademyOfMagick
Welcome to Star Academy of Magick... By joining this group you may visit our
web site at http //www.TheGifted.org for all the information about our
Academy. Members here will receive notices to schudual changes, class changes
and local activities and events during the school year. We ask all who are
sincre about learning real magick and who subscribe to this site to please
have a full Yahoo Profile filled out including your first name, age, gender,
location as in "COUNTRY, STATE/PROVENCE, ... more

-=-Topics can range from church, homeschool ideas, housekeeping tips, words
of encouragement etc-=-

NOT much range.

-=- just talk including, scripture, God, church, parents, kids, home
cleaning, lessons and curriculum, on-line courses, and web sites. -=-

They listed unschooling as a keyword. Very sad.

And the pagan school... "schudual changes. . . . all who are sincre about .
. ."

I guess not teaching my kids to write is okay.

***sigh***

So I need something short yet descriptive, clever, yet easy to spell.
Something non offensive, something maybe catchy, to draw people together, but
to ward off people we don't want to attract and let people know right away we
don't want them to come and advertise the algebra home course they just wrote
last week and that we don't want to hire someone for $350 to come and tell
our group about Charlotte Masons or Charlotte Shriners nor even Charlotte
Rainbow Girls.

The iconography of New Mexico involves road runners, zias, desert this,
mountain that, RioGrandeWhatever...
Maybe TopSecretUnschoolers
or
NancyUnDrewSchoolers
or
Pinky and the Unschooled Brain (way too long)

Unschoolulu
BabaUnschoolLoo

HomeKids

Yatta Hey! (kind of a combo Japanese and Navajo...)

Very Serious Playgroup

Holly says it should be something the kids can say so they can talk about
going there. So the name of the yahoogroup needs to be what the kids will

Scratch'n'Sniff, Holly just recommended. Then she farted dramatically.

Help!

Sandra
